alert.note: Alert for Benton; Camden; Cedar; Dallas; Douglas; Hickory; Howell; Laclede; Ozark; Phelps; Polk; Pulaski; St. Clair; Texas; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 3:38PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN WEBSTER...WRIGHT... LACLEDE...POLK...HOWELL...PULASKI...SOUTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR... SOUTHWESTERN PHELPS...HICKORY...NORTHEASTERN OZARK...DALLAS...EASTERN DOUGLAS...SOUTHEASTERN CEDAR...SOUTHERN BENTON...TEXAS AND CAMDEN COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM CDT... At 337 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fair Play to near Buffalo to 7 miles east of Conway to near Mountain Grove to 8 miles southwest of Willow Springs to near Ott. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Leonard Wood, Lebanon, West Plains, Bolivar, Pomme de Terre Lake, Stockton Lake, Ha Ha Tonka State Park, Bennett Spring State Park, Pomme De Terre State Park, Stockton State Park, Lake of The Ozarks State Park, Lake of The Ozarks, Truman Lake, Waynesville, Mountain Grove, Osage Beach, St. Robert, Camdenton, Licking and Buffalo. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 102 and 162. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Camden; Cedar; Dallas; Douglas; Hickory; Howell; Laclede; Ozark; Phelps; Polk; Pulaski; St. Clair; Texas; Webster; Wright
